com.percussion.utils.security
Interface IPSSubjectCataloger

public interface IPSSubjectCataloger

A subject cataloger is used by Rhythmyx to find any or all subjects from a source, and also to obtain specific information about a named subject. For example, an implementation of this interface may be used by the Rhyhtmyx server to catalog the subjects by name and then obtain their email addresses. findUsers(List) is used to obtain a list of matching subjects. To retrieve specific attributes from the returned subjects, Subject.getPrincipals(IPSPrincipalAttribute) is called against each subject to retrieve principals that specify the attribute value(s), and IPSPrincipalAttribute.getAttributeType() is called on each returned principal to determine the type of attribute.

Method Detail

getName

String getName()
Get the name of the cataloger instance. This is set at runtime by the system with a call to setName(String).

Returns:
The name, never null or empty.

setName

void setName(String name)
Sets the name of the cataloger instance. This is called at runtime by the system.

Parameters:
name - The name, may not be null or empty. This is the name specfied when registering the cataloger with the system.

getDescription

String getDescription()
Get the optional description of the cataloger instance. This is set at runtime by the system with a call to setDescription(String).

Returns:
The description, may be null or empty.

setDescription

void setDescription(String desc)
Sets the description of the cataloger instance. This is called at runtime by the system.

Parameters:
desc - The description, may be null or empty. This is the description specfied when registering the cataloger with the system.

findUsers

List<Subject> findUsers(List<String> names)
                        throws PSSecurityCatalogException
Returns the subjects for users that match the specified names. The returned subject's principals may contain various attributes of the subject, such as the name that was used to match on the subject, or the subject's email address. See IPSPrincipalAttribute for details on returning attributes in a subjects collection of principals. The principal attribute of type SUBJECT_NAME must always be returned.

Parameters:
names - The names of the subjects to find. Each would match the name supplied to authenticate the subject. May be null or empty to return all possible subjects. Names may contain wildcards to support filtering. Possible wildcards characters are '_' for match one character, and '%' for match any.
Returns:
The matching subjects, never null. Only subjects for which a match was found based on the supplied names are returned, and an entry with wildcards may match multiple subjects, so there is no guarantee that this list will be the same size as the supplied list of names, and it may be empty.
Throws:
PSSecurityCatalogException - if there are any errors.

supportsAttributeType

boolean supportsAttributeType(IPSPrincipalAttribute.PrincipalAttributes attrType)
Determine if subjects returned by findUsers(List) may contain an IPSPrincipalAttribute of the specified attribute type.

Parameters:
attrType - The type of attribute to check, may not be null.
Returns:
true if subjects may contain an IPSPrincipalAttribute of the specified attribute type, false if that type is not supported by this cataloger. Note that a result of true does not guarantee all subjects returned will have an attribute of the specified type, only that they might.

supportsGroups

boolean supportsGroups()
Determine if cataloging group names is supported. Used primarily by the Admin Client user interface to determine if groups can be cataloged.

Returns:
true if findGroups(String) may be called to obtain lists of groups, false if not.

findGroups

List<Principal> findGroups(String pattern)
                           throws PSSecurityCatalogException
Returns the principals representing groups whose names match the specified filter pattern. supportsGroups() should be called before calling this method to determine if groups may be cataloged.

Parameters:
pattern - The pattern to use to match the names of the groups to find. May be null or empty to return all possible group names. Possible wildcards characters are '_' for match one character, and '%' for match any.
Returns:
The list of group as principals for which a match was found based on the supplied pattern. May be empty if no groups match or if supportsGroups() would return false, never null.
Throws:
PSSecurityCatalogException - if there are any errors.

getGroupMembers

List<IPSTypedPrincipal> getGroupMembers(Collection<? extends Principal> groups)
Returns the members of the supplied groups. Any group that can be resolved should be removed from the supplied list of groups. Any groups that cannot be resolved should be left in the supplied list.

Ideally the cataloger should handle resolving nested groups to some number of levels and only principals representing users should be returned, but this is not required. All principals returned will be treated as users for such purposes as notification and community filtering.

Parameters:
groups - A list of principals representing group names, may not be null. Any of the groups resolved by this call should be removed from the list before the method returns.
Returns:
A list of group members, may be empty if there are no members or if no groups can be resolved by this cataloger. If the cataloger cannot support this operation, it should return an emtpy list and not modify the supplied list of groups.

getUserGroups

List<Principal> getUserGroups(Principal user)
Returns the list of groups of which the user is a member.

Parameters:
user - The user to check, may not be null.
Returns:
The list of groups, may be empty if the user is not a member of any groups, or if this cataloger cannot support this operation.
